modelComponent.longName: Nucleus for European Modelling of the Ocean

componentProperty.value: into grid boxes adjacent to river month; only surface (as if rain)
4000 polewards of 20N/S decrease to 2000 N/m2/s at equator

documentRelationship.description: This NEMO version is based on official release of NEMO_v2 of the NEMO group. Some bug fix and input output structure, data assimulation has been changed. For more information see http://ecearth.knmi.nl/Modification_NEMO.txt.

modelComponent.longName: Hydrological extension of the Tiled ECMWF Surface SCheme for Exchnage processes over Land

componentProperty.description: Genealogy: ECMWF development chain (Viterbo&Beljaars95, TESSEL,HTESSEL ). Coupling with atmosphere: implicit (Surface skin temperature is solved with atmospheric fluxes during every time step. Seperate caculation of surface flux es per tile, averaged to an effective surface skin temperature before calculating grid box mean fluxes. Three iterations to solve flux/gradient relationship.)

componentProperty.value: Energy and Water balance closure, Monin/Obukhov similarity, Diffusion equation in soil, no horizontal exchange between grid boxes

modelComponent.description: SnowAlbedo is a Function of Snow age and snow melt

componentProperty.value: Transpiration, evaporation, soil heat flux, shortwave reflection, longwave emission,sentible heat exchange

modelComponent.description: SchemMethod, SnowCoverFraction: Ground snow fraction for 2 snow tiles )low veg and high veg.

componentProperty.value: seperate snow tiles in general surface scheme structure.
Snowcoverfraction:Grand snow fraction for 2 snow tiles(low and high veg.)
clay/sand/silt proportion varying with soil type
6 soil types descerned, derived from FAO10' database (coarese, medium, medium fine, fine, very fine, organic)
Fixed broadband albedo derived from MODIS varying spatially and monthly

modelComponent.description: Soil MoistureFreezing/Permafrost: Diagnostic detection of frozen ground within soil profile (up to 2.89m).

componentProperty.value: diagnostic ice fraction, dependent on temperature
Light, vapour pressure deficit, soil water

documentRelationship.description: Spatial varying soil, v Gevuchten soil characteristics. Explicit surface runoff parameterization.

componentProperty.value: Solar forcing data from SPARC workinggroup on solar variability
orbital parameters are updated every timestep
prescribed volcanic aerosols from GISS for 1850-2010

componentProperty.description:
Boundary fields the model needs to run. land surface albedo, high and low vegetation types,
high and low vegetation

initial fields the model needs to run geopotential m2/s2, soil temperature level 1 K, soil temperature level 2 K, soil temperature level 3 K, soil temperature level 4 K, snow depth m of water equivalent, Charnock constant, var15, ECMWF grib code 15 var16, ECMWF grib code 16 var17, ECMWF grib code 17 var18, ECMWF grib code 18 var74, ECMWF grib code 74 Standard deviation of orography, Anisotropy of sub-gridscale orography, Angle of sub-gridscale orography, Slope of sub-gridscale orography, Land/sea mask, Surface roughness, Albedo, Skin reservoir content m of water, Logarithm of surface roughness length for heat, Skin temperature K, Temperature of snow layer K, Low vegetation cover, High vegetation cover, Type of low vegetation, Type of high vegetation, Sea-ice cover, Snow albedo, Snow density kg/m3, Sea surface temperature K, Ice surface temperature layer 1 K, Ice surface temperature layer 2 K, Ice surface temperature layer 3 K, Ice surface temperature layer 4 K, Volumetric soil water layer 1 m3/m3, Volumetric soil water layer 2 m3/m3, Volumetric soil water layer 3 m3/m3, Volumetric soil water layer 4 m3/m3, Soil type
Initial fields the model needs to run Specific humidity in kg/kg, cloud liquid water content in kg/kg, cloud ice water content in kg/kg, cloud cover.
nitial fields the model needs to run. Air temperature K, vorticity 1/s, divergence 1/s, logarithm of surface pressure, geopotential m**2 s**-2

modelComponent.description: Boundary layer turbulence scheme of the mixed layer is based on the EDMF scheme of Siebesma, Soares and Teixeira (2007) and Koehler (2005). The diffusion part is based on the K-profile closure of Troen and Mahrt (1986) while the non-local convective transport is based on a mass-flux formulation. The surface fluxes in the surface layer are expressed in terms of gradients using Monin-Obukhov similarity theory. Deep convection has an entrainment that depends on the environmental relative humidity (Bechtold et al, 2008)
Cloud and large-scale precipitation processes are described by prognostic equations for cloud liquid water/ice and cloud fraction and diagnostic relations for precipitation (Tiedtke, 1993).

componentProperty.value: detrainment, generation by cooling,advection,sedimentation of ice, warm and mixed phase precipitation generation
IR brightness and visible optical depth

modelComponent.description: A semi-langrangian advection scheme is used for momentum, temperature and moisture.
Gravity wave drag and blocked flow drag due to sub-gridscale orography are parameterised, Baines and Palmer (1990), Lott and Miller (1997)

documentRelationship.description: This version includes some improvements in clouds scheme and convective transport. Introduction of turbulent orographic form drag scheme and revision to sub-grid scale orographic drag scheme. More information see http://ecmwf.int/publications/newsletters/pdf/109.pdf

componentProperty.value: sea-ice[thickness, concentration, velocity, temperature, heat content], snow thickness, snow temperature.
depending on snow/ice, clear/overcast sky, snow melting/freezing
ice formed with from prescribed thickness
one layer of snow but the snow-ice system consists of two layers.
multi-layer on a regular vertical grid

documentRelationship.description: It defined now on global domain and incorperates a detailed repersentation of ice dynamics and a more complete treatments of ice thermal dynamic processes affecting sea-ice. Fichefet, T., and M. A. Morales Maqueda, 1997.

The surface module Tessel has been replaced by HTessel for compatibility with cycle 33. Deep convection parameterization from IFS cycle 33 has been implemented, the gravity wave drag and shortwave radiation inhomogeneity factor have been modified and an improved mass conservation correction scheme has been introduced. Improvements in the snow parameterizatin are included. Furthermore, the wet uptake of aerosols has been included.
